pullrequest.title: Added boolean, pass by reference value GetParam to PhysicsEngine

content.raw: Indeed. `PhysicsEngine` has many elements that are shared between physics engines. In this pull request or in the future, `PhysicsEngine` should be refactored to also include  `SetParam` for these elements, and each physics engine should inherit the corresponding member variables for these elements. This is true for most shared physics elements, except for max_contacts, gravity, and magnetic field.
content.html: Indeed. PhysicsEngine has many elements that are shared between physics engines. In this pull request or in the future, PhysicsEngine should be refactored to also include SetParam for these elements, and each physics engine should inherit the corresponding member variables for these elements. This is true for most shared physics elements, except for max_contacts, gravity, and magnetic field.

pullrequest.title: Added boolean, pass by reference value GetParam to PhysicsEngine

content.raw: It's an extra level of indirection, but I slightly prefer calling the accessors (`GetMaxTimeStep`, `GetGravity`) in this function to reduce duplicate code.
content.html: It's an extra level of indirection, but I slightly prefer calling the accessors (GetMaxTimeStep, GetGravity) in this function to reduce duplicate code.

pullrequest.title: Added boolean, pass by reference value GetParam to PhysicsEngine

content.raw: Heh, I was actually thinking in the future or in this pull request we could either deprecate these accessors or call GetParam inside of them instead to avoid this indirection (same for SetParam).
content.html: Heh, I was actually thinking in the future or in this pull request we could either deprecate these accessors or call GetParam inside of them instead to avoid this indirection (same for SetParam).

pullrequest.title: Added boolean, pass by reference value GetParam to PhysicsEngine

content.raw: These few accessors don't bother me, so it hadn't occurred to me to deprecate them, but we can discuss that. `GetMaxStepSize` is called by [World::Step](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/37a2ff7f107d2b23ea9d262d93c664399843d634/gazebo/physics/World.cc#cl-602) as part of the physics update loop, so I'd prefer to keep that function stream-lined for now (calling `GetParam` could slow things down).
content.html: These few accessors don't bother me, so it hadn't occurred to me to deprecate them, but we can discuss that. GetMaxStepSize is called by World::Step as part of the physics update loop, so I'd prefer to keep that function stream-lined for now (calling GetParam could slow things down).

content.html:

boost::any value;
if (this->GetWorld()->GetPhysicsEngine()->GetParam(
    "contact_max_correcting_vel", value))
  g->GetODESurface()->maxVel = boost::any_cast<double>(value);

content.raw: It was actually aborting before it got here when it tried to `GetElement("dart")`. I replaced that with the `if (!HasElement("dart"))`, and it's working now. I deleted this, but we can add it back if you want it.
content.html: It was actually aborting before it got here when it tried to GetElement("dart"). I replaced that with the if (!HasElement("dart")), and it's working now. I deleted this, but we can add it back if you want it.

pullrequest.title: Added boolean, pass by reference value GetParam to PhysicsEngine

content.raw: In all of these cases, `bool GetParam` will already give an error message if it returns false. All physics engine implementations of this function call `PhysicsEngine::GetParam` if they can't find the parameter, and `PhysicsEngine` will return false and output a warning (#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1496/added-boolean-pass-by-reference-value/diff#Lgazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine.ccT250). I can change the gzwarn to a gzerr if you prefer, but I don't think another message needs to be added here.
content.html: In all of these cases, bool GetParam will already give an error message if it returns false. All physics engine implementations of this function call PhysicsEngine::GetParam if they can't find the parameter, and PhysicsEngine will return false and output a warning (#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1496/added-boolean-pass-by-reference-value/diff#Lgazebo/physics/PhysicsEngine.ccT250). I can change the gzwarn to a gzerr if you prefer, but I don't think another message needs to be added here.
